reviews.review_msg: Dr. Wereha is amazing! He is smart, interesting, funny and easy to pay attention to. He skillfully handles complex material making it accessible and engaging for students. His lectures are dynamic and charged. This is a great class for anyone who hopes to be inspired to think outside the box (or think at all for that matter) BONUS: he's super cute!

Best TA I have ever had. Two courses back to back (psych 300 too) with Tyler as my TA, he was very fair, passionate about what he discussed, interested in us doing better, and an overall epic TA. Recommend him for a prof as well.
Bryan is amazing! Really funny, conveys material well & marks really easily. You only have to read the articles required for papers & attend class and you will get an A.

bryan sokol is the best!! hes from the south so he talks slow but has a good sense of humor and attempts to engage the class to make the material less boring...the material is dry, but readings arent mandatory and as long as you show up to class and its difficult not to get an A

Dr. Sokol is a super nice person and has a really unique, great sense of humor. The material was bone dry and I don't feel that I learned much...I thought it'd be a different course and not Genetic Epistemology. If you HAVE to take this crummy course then Sokol is the one to take it with. :)

GPA booster if you study HARD. Jeremy speaks in a monotone so lectures are extremely boring. tho that doesn't matter because TA's are more important.  just make sure you get a good TA and you like him/her, because tutorials are the most important component of this class. Do the study questions, and you'll be fine. Tyler was a really good TA.

I would also like to add that during our WebCT discussions, the proff nor even the tutor were consistent in answering the student's questions, ever!!. A good proff like  Dr. Racine, actually took the time to help answer his students on WEBCT where he didn't even get paid for it! Now that is a proff that cares about his students! Avoid this proff pl

Interesting prof and high up in the field.  The package of articles is not great but he does a good job of narrowing it all down.  Watch out for the TAs though.  The course is great dependent on who you get as a TA.
